intro: Oxleya, commonly known as the silky oak, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The genus includes several species, with Oxleya australis being the most well-known. These plants are often found in rainforests and are valued for their ornamental beauty and ecological importance. Oxleya species are also noted for their ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
